lexUnit.name: fumble.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: seek with clumsy, uncertain movements of the hands

sentence.text: She ordered a snowball , and fumbled in her bag for the price of it .
She fumbled feverishly in a fancy box on the table for a paper handkerchief .
To hide her embarrassment she fumbled in her handbag for a little mirrored compact backed with tortoiseshell and turned away to repowder her face .
He pulled the small plastic box free and laid it on top of the crate , fumbling in his jacket pocket for something .
He noticed that he was almost out of them and fumbled in his jacket pocket for some change to feed into the cigarette machine .
Dorcas fumbled in his pockets until he found a stub of pencil lead .
Electing to leave him to his own devices , I wave through the windscreen but he is still fumbling through his camera bag and does n't say goodbye .
There I fumbled under my costume for my pendant , and called Posi .
Then , remembering , he fumbled under the pillows for Trent 's Walther .
Sheldukher fumbled for his laser pistol .
Now I can not bear the darkness and have to keep on relighting the candle , fumbling for the matches in the total darkness .
I had to fumble for the torch in the dark and work out for myself how to fix my bunk .
" Nettlerash , " I replied , fumbling among my bottles for the adrenalin .
Aunt Emily fumbled beneath her pillows and pulled out a small fat volume bound in red morocco .
